meanings.definition: A pigment that gives color to plants and animals.
meanings.sent1: The carotinoid in the flower made it bright orange.
meanings.sent2: The leaves turned red in the fall due to the carotinoid present in them.
meanings.sent3: The carrot was so full of carotinoid that it looked like a little sun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a carotinoid, spreading warmth and brightness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with vibrant carotinoid hues.

meanings.definition: Any of a class of yellow to red pigments occurring in plants and animals.
meanings.sent1: The carotinoid found in carrots gives them their distinctive orange color.
meanings.sent2: The flamingo's feathers get their pink color from the carotinoid in their diet.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a carotinoid rainbow with flowers of every shade.
meanings.sent4: His fiery personality matched the carotinoid intensity of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The autumn trees blazed with the fiery carotinoid colors of the season.
